Text: If you can't play DTS and would like to convert it please download only the sample then demux the audio track and fiddle with it. I tried with eac3to and with PopCorn MKV AudioConverter without success.

German hardcoded subs for the Spanish speaking(they were originally on blue-ray so don't blame me), meanwhile English Forced Subs are default so English Forced (srt) will display over the German, I recommend you change display color of subs in your player (neon-green for instance).
They are just a few short Spanish parts.
Italians can switch to Forced Italian sub.

I've downloaded the torrent, but all I see is green screen. Both sound and subs work great - but the video isn't. I tried several codec packs, including k-lite and CCCP, but nothing. Needless to say that I have no problem watching other mkv videos.
Somebody knows which codec I have to use?
Tnx.

The second English sub track is only for the English dialogue, it's blank for the Spanish dialogue.

So you get English subs for either the Spanish dialogue or the remainder English dialogue, but not both. You have to switch back and forth.

@dlectro
Why don't you complain at bluray.com & amazon.
I ripped all subs from blu-ray. I can't do more.
Others don't even rip the English sub, not to speak about 20 subs.
